alert.note: Alert for Benton; Henry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 19 at 3:56AM CDT until July 19 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Benton County in west Tennessee... Central Henry County in west Tennessee... * Until 445 AM CDT. * At 356 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles northeast of Cottage Grove, or 10 miles north of Paris, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Paris, Camden, Paris Landing State Park, Springville, Puryear, Big Sandy, Mansfield, Haigler Ridge, Foundry Hill, Manleyville, Old Springville, Crossland, Buchanan, India, Sunnyside, Van Dyke, Whitlock, Spring Creek, Porter Court and Conyersville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
